Package supermart.backEnd

Class Store

  • java.lang.Object
    • supermart.backEnd.Store

  • public class Store
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Zaine Ashe - 09469010 Builds a Store object.

    Builds a Store object with it's own stock and capital that changes when new items are bought and sold. Must be a Singleton.

      • ChangeQuantity

        public void ChangeQuantity​(Item item,
                           int quantity)
                    throws StockException
        Adds to the quantity of the selected item in the stores stock
        Parameters:
        item - The item to have it's quantity changed
        quantity - The amount added to the items quantity
        Throws:
        StockException - Thrown if the item isn't in the stores stock

      • AddCapital

        public void AddCapital​(double capital)
                throws DeliveryException
        Adds the set amount to the stores already existing capital
        Parameters:
        capital - The amount to be added
        Throws:
        DeliveryException - Thrown if the result is negative

      • SetStock

        public void SetStock​(Stock newStock)
        Sets the stores stock to a new one
        Parameters:
        newStock - The new stock the store will use

      • generateNewOrder

        public java.util.ArrayList<Item> generateNewOrder​()
        Generate a new stock order to send through to the CSV Reader

        algorithm that checks each item in the store's stock, and builds an arraylist of all the items that need to be reordered. The list is sorted in ascending order by each item's temperature, with the dry items appended on the end.

        Returns:
        array list of each item in the current inventory that needs reordering

      • ImportSales

        public void ImportSales​(Stock toAdd)
                 throws StockException
        Process sales from a given sales stock

        This method calls when a sales log CSV is imported in the GUI. the CSV Reader generates a sales stock from the given csv file, and passes that data over to the ImportSales method for it to make changes. This method then loops through each item in the sales stock and 'sells' them. Increasing store capital and decreasing quantities in the store's inventory

        Parameters:
        toAdd - the toAdd stock passed through by the CSV reader, contains item references and quantities for reordering
        Throws:
        StockException - if a sale results in a negative quantity, or an item in log is not in the inventory

      • ImportItems

        public void ImportItems​(Stock toAdd)
        Initialise new items into the store's inventory

        this is the method called from the back-end when the 'Import Items' button is pushed in the GUI it takes a stock full of items from the CSV reader, and uses it to initialise new items into the store stock. Each new item is initialised at quantity 0

        Parameters:
        toAdd - a stock instance full of items that will be iterated through in the ImportItems method

      • ImportManifest

        public void ImportManifest​(Manifest toAdd)
                    throws DeliveryException,
                           StockException
        Process a delivery order to restock the store's inventory

        This is the method that's called by the Gui's "Import Manifest" button. Method loops through each item in the given truck order, and 'buys' them. Altering given quantities in the stores inventory and changing store capital based on the price of trucks and buying cost of each item involved.

        Parameters:
        toAdd - the manifest given by the CSVReader's 'ImportManifest' method
        Throws:
        DeliveryException - if the manifest tries to reference an item which doesnt exist in the store inventory
        StockException - if the changeQuantity method (processing adding quantity to an inventory item) creates a negative quantity
